title: Millwall want to speak to Mark Cooper about vacant managerial job
text:
Millwall are keen to speak to Forest Green Rovers manager Mark Cooper about succeeding Neil Harris at The Den.

Cooper, 50, has vast experience in the lower leagues and has guided Forest Green to second in League Two just months after narrowly missing out on a play-off final.

Roy Keane is also in the running with Gary Rowett and Motherwell boss Stephen Robinson also among those discussed.

Millwall are keen to speak to Forest Green Rovers manager Mark Cooper about their job

Millwall were shocked last week when long-serving Harris, 42, and his assistant David Livermore left the club.

Harris said: 'I truly believe that I leave the club in a very healthy position in terms of infrastructure, staffing and playing squad which gives a new manager a platform to continue the club's development.

'During the last four and a half years as manager, there have been some incredible successes for our club, including two Wembley play-off finals, a promotion back to the Championship, two FA Cup quarter-finals and, now, relative stability in the second tier of England's very competitive league structure.'
description: Mark Cooper, 50, has vast experience in the lower leagues and has guided Forest Green Rovers to second in League Two just months after narrowly missing out on a play-off final.
authors: Simon Jones For The Mail On Sunday
